item.title: Trees overhanging, 28th June
item.description:
The trees are overhanging the roads, the buses are constantly smashing off of them. I have a daughter who is awake most of the summer nights, as the windows have to be open but the awful noise of these trees catapulting off of the buses is keeping her awake. They are so overhung in both the road and on the pavement it’s is becoming impossible to walk without having to duck. It’s also dangerous as the branches are being snapped off from the gravity of the buses and pinging everywhere, it won’t be long before someone gets hurt. The tree outside of 24 Dartmouth Park Hill is bending so much that it is pulling out of the ground and lifrjnf the pavement, this has resulted in people falling and tripping over the lifted pavement Slabs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartmouth Park Hill, Archway, London
Report on FixMyStreet
